items.title: Guardians' Clase, Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches for bettors
items.summary_auto: Two Major League Baseball pitchers were indicted Sunday on charges they took bribes to give sports bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they'd throw and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes to ensure successful bets.

items.title: Trump administration wants U.S. states to 'undo' full payouts of SNAP food benefits
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is demanding states "undo" full SNAP food benefits paid out under judges' orders over the past week, now that the U.S. Supreme Court has stayed those rulings, marking the latest swing in a seesawing legal battle over the anti-hunger program used by 42 million Americans.

items.title: BBC director, head of news resign after criticism of Trump speech edits
items.summary_auto: The head of the BBC and the British broadcaster's top news executive both resigned Sunday after criticism of the way the organization edited a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump.

items.title: Chara, Keith, Botterill, Thornton and rest of Hockey Hall of Fame class set for Monday induction
items.summary_auto: Zdeno Chara and Duncan Keith will be inducted into the Hall of Fame alongside fellow former players Joe Thornton, Alexander Mogilny, Jennifer Botterill and Brianna Decker on Monday in Toronto. Jack Parker and Danièle Sauvageau will enter as builders.

items.title: Thousands of knitted poppies cover buildings across Niagara for Remembrance Day
items.summary_auto: Communities over the Niagara Region cover their museums, churches and legions in crocheted poppies as part of a local art project that grew into an international effort in the first year of the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: Gaza death toll tops 69,000 as Israel and militants again exchange remains
items.summary_auto: More than 69,000 Palestinians have been killed in the Israel-Hamas war so far, Gaza health officials said Saturday, as both sides completed the latest exchange of bodies under the terms of the tenuous ceasefire.

items.title: Super Typhoon Fung-wong hits Philippines after more than 1 million people evacuated
items.summary_auto: Super Typhoon Fung-wong slammed ashore Sunday on the northeastern coast of the Philippines, where the massive storm had already left at least two people dead and forced more than a million people to evacuate from flood- and landslide-prone areas, officials said.

items.title: Who's who of rock 'n' roll — from young stars to legends — celebrate Hall of Fame inductees
items.summary_auto: Cyndi Lauper turned True Colors into a defiant call for courage, and the music of Outkast, Soundgarden and the White Stripes moved the house on Saturday night at the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony.

items.title: Canada could face ‘worst kind’ of flu season as experts warn evolving strain may be mismatch for vaccine
items.summary_auto: With flu cases now rising in Canada, medical experts are bracing for a difficult influenza season linked to the global spread of an evolving H3N2 strain that could be a mismatch for this year’s vaccine.

items.title: Old caves yield new secrets from Canadians who went over the top at Vimy Ridge
items.summary_auto: A hidden archive of what for many were last thoughts and tributes to Canada is emerging from the soft chalk tunnels beneath the Vimy Ridge battlefield more than a century after they were created.

items.title: Could a rise in Indigenous-led developments move the needle on Canada's housing shortage?
items.summary_auto: From Squamish Nation in B.C. to Millbrook First Nation in N.S., housing developments led by Indigenous peoples are on the rise. Often offered through leaseholds, some say these homes are helping with the country's housing crisis.

items.title: Life was a constant rush until the day a car hit me. It was the wake-up call I needed
items.summary_auto: Marwa Abu Eita used to spend 13-hour days rushing from one task to the next until a vehicle plowed into her at a busy intersection. Her recovery helped her embrace a slower pace of life.

items.title: Advocates concerned temporary immigration cuts don't address systemic issues
What’s in the federal budget for you? Your questions answered
Saskatchewan Roughriders to face Montreal Alouettes at next week's Grey Cup
items.summary_auto: The Saskatchewan defence forced back-to-back two-and-out possessions to give their offence an opportunity to win the game.

items.title: Riders score late TD to down Lions, punch ticket to Grey Cup
items.summary_auto: The Saskatchewan defence forced back-to-back two-and-out possessions to give their offence an opportunity to win the game.

items.title: Tania Willard wins the 2025 Sobey Art Award
items.summary_auto: Known for her work with Indigenous land-based practices, the artist from Niskonlith, B.C., is the recipient of the $100,000 grand prize.
